section: Computer data and file structure, and databases
question: Which one of the following is NOT a hashing method for hashed files?
A hashed file is a random access file in which a ____ maps a key to an address.
Which one of the following statements regarding sequential files is NOT TRUE?
options: There are four files associated with an update program: the old and new master files, transaction file, and error report file
The new master file contains changes to be applied to the old master file
All the files need to be sorted on the same key to make the updating process efficient
A loop is used to read and process records one by one
answer: The new master file contains changes to be applied to the old master file

question: Which one of the following statements regarding linked lists is NOT TRUE?
options: A linked list is a suitable structure if a large number of insertions and deletions are needed
The same operations defined for an array can be applied to a linked list
A linked list can grow infinitely and shrink to an empty list
The name of a linked list is the name of the head pointer that points to the last node of the list
answer: The name of a linked list is the name of the head pointer that points to the last node of the list

question: How many pointers are used when trying to find an element in a linked list?
Which algorithm must be applied to a linked list before an item is inserted into it?
Which of the following operations can be defined on an array?
An array is ___
options: a collection of fields that are all related to one object
a sequenced collection of elements, normally of the same data type
a collection of elements called fields
answer: a sequenced collection of elements, normally of the same data type

question: Which one of the following is NOT a data structure?
Which one of the following statements regarding documentation in the software lifecycle is NOT TRUE?
options: Service documentation defines how the system should be maintained and updated if necessary
Documentation stops when software is tested
Technical documentation describes the installation and servicing of a software system
answer: Documentation stops when software is tested

question: Basis path testing is a method in which each statement in the software is executed ____
___ Between modules in a software system must be minimized
When considering software quality, maintainability includes:
options: Only A, B, D and E
A, B, C, D and E
answer: Only A, B, D and E

question: Which of the following statements regarding the analysis phase of the software life cycle are NOT TRUE?
data: A. A specification document is produced that shows what the software will do without specifying how it will be done
B. In this phase it must be known what type of programming language will be used in the implementation phase
C. Data flow diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams and state diagrams are modelling tools that can be used in this phase
D. A use-case diagram is a modelling tool that can be used in this phase to show how users communicate with the system

question: Compilation ____
options: translates and executes the source code a line at a time
is used in the first approach to interpretation
translates the whole source program into the object module before executing it
answer: translates the whole source program into the object module before executing it

question: Which one of the following statements regarding an algorithm is NOT TRUE?
options: It is a step-by-step method for solving a problem
It is dependent on the computer system
answer: It is dependent on the computer system

question: Suppose a list contains the following elements: 47, 98, 22, 13, 93, 8. What is the order of the elements in the list after three passes if bubble sort is used?

question: During ___, more than one program can be in memory at the same time and executed concurrently.

section: Computer systems, organisation and networks
question: An operating system (OS) can be programmed in a modular architecture with several layers such that higher layers can be changed without affecting the lower layers. This property refers to the ____ of the OS.
explanation: Extensibility refers to the ability of a system to be expanded or modified with new functionality without disrupting existing components. In an OS with modular architecture, higher layers can change independently of lower ones, demonstrating this property.

question: An operating system is a(n):
data: A. Program that facilitates the execution of other programs
B. Interface between the hardware of a computer and the user
C. Program that facilitates access to hardware resources, but not software resources

question: There are several layers in a TCP/IP protocol suite. The transport layer is responsible for ____
options: logical delivery of a message between client and server processes
the delivery of individual packets from the source host to the destination host
the movement of individual bits from one node to the next
answer: logical delivery of a message between client and server processes

section: Computer systems, organisation and networks
question: What is the MAIN factor that differentiates a wide area network (WAN) from a local area network (LAN)?
options: The sizes of the geographical areas covered by the networks
The number of nodes on the networks
The number of computers on the networks
answer: The sizes of the geographical areas covered by the networks

section: Computer systems, organisation and networks
question: A small part of a star LAN with 150 stations is damaged. How many stations are affected by this damage?
options: All 150 stations are affected if special provisions are not made
Only the stations on the damaged portion of the network are affected
No station is affected if special provisions are made
answer: Only the stations on the damaged portion of the network are affected

Which of the following statements regarding memory is FALSE?
options: Static RAM (SRAM) technology uses traditional flip-flop gates to hold data
Dynamic RAM (DRAM) is faster than SRAM
answer: Dynamic RAM (DRAM) is faster than SRAM

question: Where is cache memory located?
options: between the CPU and main memory
answer: between the CPU and main memory

question: What is the output of Gate 4?
What is the output of Gate 3?
What is the output of Gate 2?
What is the output of Gate 1?
Which term represents Group 1?
Which term represents Group 2?
Which term represents Group 32?

Consider the following Boolean function F(x, y, z) = m₁ + m₃ + m₄ + m₆. Which one of the following four Karnaugh diagrams represents the given function?
options:
1.
       y'z'   y'z    yz    yz'
   x'         1             1
   x     1                 1

2.
       y'z'   y'z    yz    yz'
   x'  1       1             1
   x                 1

3.
       y'z'   y'z    yz    yz'
   x'         1       1       
   x     1                 1

4.
       y'z'   y'z    yz    yz'
   x'  1       1       1     
   x                     1
answer:
1.
       y'z'   y'z    yz    yz'
   x'         1             1
   x     1                 1

Images can be stored in a computer by using the raster graphics technique. The following statements regarding this technique are TRUE:
options: Only A, B, C and E
A, B, C, D and E
answer: A, B, C, D and E
data: A. Raster graphics is used when we need to store an analog image such as a photograph
B. The scanning rate in image processing is called resolution
C. The number of bits used to represent a pixel depends on how a pixel's colour is handled by different encoding techniques

D. The number of bits used to represent a pixel depends on how a pixel's colour is handled by different encoding techniques. JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group) uses the True-Color scheme, and GIF (Graphic Interchange Format) uses the indexed colour scheme
E. Raster graphics has two disadvantages: the file size is big and rescaling is troublesome

section: Computer data and file structure, and databases
question: Which of the following statements is TRUE?
options: A database management system (DBMS) defines, creates and maintains a database and allows controlled access to users
A database is a collection of data that is always logically and physically coherent
A DBMS is exclusively composed of software, data, users and procedures
A DBMS has four levels: internal, conceptual, hierarchical and external
answer: A database management system (DBMS) defines, creates and maintains a database and allows controlled access to users

question: In a relational database, several operations can be defined in order to create new relations out of the existing ones. Select the statement that is NOT TRUE regarding operations on relations within the relational database management system (RDBMS) context.
options: The insert operation is a unary operation
The select operation is a unary operation
The join operation is a binary operation
The update operation is a binary operation
answer: The update operation is a binary operation

question: Consider the following statements
options: Only A and B are false
Only C and D are false
Only A, B and C are true
Only A, C and D are true
answer: Only A, B and C are true

B. In a fragmented distributed database, data are localised
C. In a replicated distributed database, each site holds an exact replica of another site
D. An object-oriented database tries to keep the advantages of the relational model and, therefore, it does not allow applications to access structured data

section: Computer data and file structure, and databases
question: In the open addressing collision resolution method, which statement is correct?
options: The first record is stored in the home address, but contains a pointer to the second record
Each collision resolution decreases the probability of future collisions
Data that cannot be stored in the home address can be stored in the next address
answer: Data that cannot be stored in the home address can be stored in the next address

section: Computer data and file structure, and databases
question: In direct hashing, which statement is correct?
options: The key is divided by the file size and the address is the remainder plus I
The key is the address and no algorithm manipulation is necessary
The address is composed of digits selected from the key
Each record must be accessed sequentially
answer: The key is the address and no algorithm manipulation is necessary

section: Computer algorithms, programming and software development
question: Which of the following operations are BOTH lengthy and time consuming when the operation has to be done in the middle of an array?
explanation: In an array, elements are stored in contiguous memory locations. When inserting or deleting in the middle, all subsequent elements must be shifted, which makes these operations time-consuming compared to searching or retrieval.
